alert.note: Alert for Ohio (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Ohio County through 430 AM CDT... At 400 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Livermore, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Hartford around 415 AM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
